titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Calvin Ira Kephart, 1960, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Ava Dickerson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:33:12 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Kephart mss., 1960, consists of the manuscript of Races of Mankind by C. I. Kephart, amateur ethnologist.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Colonel Calvin Ira Kephart, 1883-1969, worked as a professor at George Washington University for twelve years. His six degrees specialized in genealogy and heraldry, and he served as president of the National Genealogical Society for two terms. Kephart is best known for his ethnological monograph, Races of Mankind.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the manuscript of Races of Mankind: Their Origin and Migration by Calvin Ira Kephart, 1883-1969, professor of law and amateur ethnologist. Also included is a page proof of the index. A printed copy of Kephart's pamphlet True Christianity is present in the Vertical File.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Kephart mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
